sentences.english: The puppet troops suffered disastrous defeat.
sentences.chinese: 伪军遭到了灾难性的失败。

sentences.english: Qiao Jishan line with puppet fire door.
sentences.chinese: 乔继山一行同门口伪军交火。

sentences.english: Three white dress uniform pseudo into a concentration camp, he took out the arraignment.
sentences.chinese: 白三穿着伪军装进了集中营，他拿出提审令。

sentences.english: The puppet soldiers offered no resistance and surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 伪军没有抵抗就投降了。

sentences.english: The puppet soldiers searched the village for our underground workers.
sentences.chinese: 伪军在全村搜寻我们的地下工作人员。

sentences.english: Two the elves Miaoxiang son kill the guards back.
sentences.chinese: 苗香儿杀死看守后门的两个伪军。

sentences.english: They killed45 puppet troops and sent the rest fleeing panic-stricken.
sentences.chinese: 他们打死45名伪军，使其他的人都惊惶逃窜了。

sentences.english: The whole village was burnt down by the puppet troops.
sentences.chinese: 整个村子都被伪军焚毁了。

sentences.english: A see the village appeared two the elves.
sentences.chinese: 一看到村子里出现了二个伪军。

sentences.english: A puppet troop revolted last week.
sentences.chinese: 上星期一支伪军部队起义了。

sentences.english: More and more puppet troops crossed over to the people's side.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的伪军投奔到人民这方面来。

sentences.english: The puppet troops burnt the whole village down.
They rushed a brigade of puppet troops to reinforce the area.
sentences.chinese: 他们赶运了一旅伪军来增援这个地区。

definition: Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
Japanese devil (common term of abuse in wartime China and in subsequent writing)
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
devils/refers to 日本鬼子, wartime term insult for Japanese
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
